block.p: Suzanne Jeannette Irving, the daughter of Joyce E. Irving and J. Bruce Irving, both of Miami, was married yesterday to Alexander Charles Michener Baillie, a son of Marilyn and A. Charles Baillie of Toronto. The Rev. George Chalmers, a minister of the Church of Scotland, performed the ceremony at the Sorn Parish Church in Sorn, Scotland.

The bride and bridegroom received master's degrees from Oxford University, she in international relations and he in politics, philosophy and economics. They later attended Harvard University, from which the bride received a law degree and the bridegroom an M.B.A.

Suzanne Jeannette Irving, the daughter of Joyce E. Irving and J. Bruce Irving, both of Miami, was married yesterday to Alexander Charles Michener Baillie, a son of Marilyn and A. Charles Baillie of Toronto. The Rev. George Chalmers, a minister of the Church of Scotland, performed the ceremony at the Sorn Parish Church in Sorn, Scotland.

The bride and bridegroom received master's degrees from Oxford University, she in international relations and he in politics, philosophy and economics. They later attended Harvard University, from which the bride received a law degree and the bridegroom an M.B.A.

Mrs. Baillie, 32, is an associate at Debevoise & Plimpton, the New York law firm. She graduated from Yale University. Her father is a lawyer in private practice in Miami. Her mother is a residential real estate agent for J Poole Associates, a real estate agency in Miami.

Mr. Baillie, 33, is known as Charles. He is an executive director for mergers and acquisitions in the London office of Goldman, Sachs. He graduated from Queens University in Kingston, Ontario. His mother is an author of children's nonfiction books. His father is the chairman of the Toronto-Dominion Bank and of its online securities brokerage subsidiary, TD Waterhouse Group.
